eu.play_project.play_platformservices.api

Interface QueryDispatchApi

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    PlayPlatformservices, PlayPlatformservicesRest

    public interface QueryDispatchApi
    Accepts a BDPL query to decompose.
    Author:
    Stefan Obermeier, Roland St√ºhmer

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      QueryDetails analyseQuery(String queryId, String query)
      To get details about a query.
      List<Query> getRegisteredQueries()
      Get all currently registered queries.
      Query getRegisteredQuery(String queryId)
      Get a registered query identified by its query ID which was used when registering it.

      void unregisterQuery(String queryId)
      To unregister a query from the PLAY platform.

    • Method Detail

      • registerQuery

        String registerQuery(String queryId,
                   String bdplQuery)
                     throws QueryDispatchException
        To register a query with the PLAY platform.
        Parameters:
        queryId - An HTTP URI as an identifier for the query.
        query - BDPL query.
        Throws:
        QueryDispatchException

      • unregisterQuery

        void unregisterQuery(String queryId)
        To unregister a query from the PLAY platform.
        Parameters:
        queryId - An HTTP URI as an identifier for the query.

      • analyseQuery

        QueryDetails analyseQuery(String queryId,
                        String query)
                          throws QueryDispatchException
        To get details about a query. This operation does not register the query and can be used to do checks on the query before registering.
        Throws:
        QueryDispatchException - if the query contains errors

      • getRegisteredQuery

        Query getRegisteredQuery(String queryId)
                         throws QueryDispatchException
        Get a registered query identified by its query ID which was used when registering it.
        Throws:
        QueryDispatchException - if there is no query for the given ID

      • getRegisteredQueries

        List<Query> getRegisteredQueries()
        Get all currently registered queries.
